abstract: "Priscilla Queen of the Desert," which opened to mixed reviews in March and had one of the rockiest summers at the box office for new productions, had its highest-earning set of performances last week since late May
snippet: "Priscilla Queen of the Desert," which opened to mixed reviews in March and had one of the rockiest summers at the box office for new productions, had its highest-earning set of performances last week since late May
lead_paragraph: The Broadway musical "Priscilla Queen of the Desert," which opened to mixed reviews in March and had one of the rockiest summers at the box office for new productions, had its highest-earning set of performances last week since late May, according to box office data released on Monday by the Broadway League, a trade group for theater owners and producers. "Priscilla" earned $860,673, about 59 percent of the maximum possible gross last week; the show earned $920,741 during the playing week that included Memorial Day weekend, while it reached a low point of $547,180 in early September.

headline.main: A Good Week for 'Priscilla' at the Box Office
